page.title: 13ASHINGTON CHURCH.
page.content: Ashington Church is dedicated to St. Vincent.There are no electric lights so the church is lit by candles .The candlesticks stand on one long pole and each one holds three candles.The pews at the front are like boxes which have seats inside for the rich people and can be entered by a door.The altar has a brass cross with two brass candlesticks either side.The pulpit is a square shape with a sounding board above it.On the outside of the church is a carving of two angels.There are two parts to the church,a south porch and a west bell_cote.There is also a buttress supporting a bell tower with two bells.On the outside of the main door is a sanctuary handle. A long time ago when a thief was being chased by the villagers he could reach for this and then remain inside the church without being harmed.
